Topic.Title: Interesting article about text based rpg MUDs and what keeps them going

Posts.EditableText:
In a day and age where gorgeous graphics draw in the big crowds, one journalist asks the question, "What keeps people coming back to text based MUDs after all this time. Those that still play, what are your thoughts?

[url:35mwjssz]http://kernelmag.dailydot.com/issue-sections/headline-story/13506/avalon-neverending-mud/[/url:35mwjssz]
Posts.HTML:
In a day and age where gorgeous graphics draw in the big crowds, one journalist asks the question, "What keeps people coming back to text based MUDs after all this time. Those that still play, what are your thoughts?

http://kernelmag.dailydot.com/issue-sections/headline-story/13506/avalon-neverending-mud/

Posts.EditableText:
the power of the brain: imagination!

the same question (your post's question) is answered by this question:

in a day and age where you got incredible 3d CGI graphics in movies and games, why do people still read books ???

the power of the brain: imagination!

(though actually being able to see~watch~move stuff, is very nice too, so imagination leaves room for such visual 3d graphics in movies and games, hehe)
